intro: Hieracium murrianum subsp. rhoeadifolium, commonly known as the yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in sandy or loamy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its spread across various habitats.
